The food was great but the decor needs an update...I liked the shrimp cerviche, and freaking loved the appetizer Papa something basically a fried ball of meat and potato...The sauce was really good, like a smoky poblano flavor.The cuban I didnt like, it was the other meat besides the pork on the cuban that I didnt like.I will definitely will be back again!

Holy crap.. their huevos rancheros is incredible. Love the poached egg in a tortilla cup with a spicy tomato sauce. I love how small and mom and pop it is. It's cramped and you'll be elbowed in the head at least once every time you dine there. It's not award winning service.. but I give them a pass cause it's delicious.
Food is great! I had the grilled pork chops which were so tender, so good, soooo good.It's small inside and there will be a wait, especially on the weekends but worth it!

Despite being in New York dozens of times I had never gone over to Hoboken. Just a short trip on the PATH train, however, yielded a couple great things - a wonderful, unique view of Manhattan and a delicious Cuban lunch. La Isla is a tiny lunch counter with a handful of four-top tables. We had a group of five so four of us took a table and one sat adjacent at the counter. We were not headed for this place, but rather stumbled on it by virtue of Yelp.We tried numerous dishes all of which had a delicious home-cooked flavor. It's as if a kind family opened their kitchen to serve you the same wonderful food they're having. The chicken was succulent and beautiful with a nice, roasted flavor. The plantains were delicious. One of the kids tried a signature dish which is a mashed potato ball filled with meat and he loved it. The real standout was "Tasajo" which is a braised beef dish but the starting product is a cured meat. This was served over yellow rice with beans and Cuban sweet potatoes. Really delicious. We did not know, but the chef here, Omar has been featured on a few television shows including Bobby Flay's Throwdown in which he bested Bobby and on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. We also didn't realize that he was sitting right next to us while on a break from the kitchen. He was kind and affable and we discussed various culinary trends happening both locally and in other cities. If you like Cuban food, I highly recommend this place.

Hoboken has a lot of good food. Don't hate. I love this place! It has a lot of culture and the ladies that work here look like they are very dedicated to their job. Most importantly they make a mean Cuban sandwich. I love it. My boyfriend thinks its a little dry, but the right cuban doesnt have any sauces in it like most i've had that are not authentic.We only ordered take out. I'm excited to come back and try more deliciousness!

This is the absolute best brunch/breakfast location in Hoboken, and possibly the world.  Their French toast beat Bobby Flay on Food Network's Throw Down, and their omelettes are out of this world.  The Cuban toast and Cuban latte are likewise amazing and you can't beat their prices. I've eaten here for lunch and dinner as well, which were likewise superb, but the breakfast menu is really stellar. I can't say enough good things about this place.

great, cheap, large-portioned, diner-esque cuban comfort food!not only is the food tasty, comforting, and plentiful, i really like the drinks! the coffee and the soda....i absolutely hate soda normally but they got some exotic ones that are super fun and delicious.ropa vieja is one of my faves, skirt steak is ok, enjoyable but not the best ever. the fried meat-potato ball thing rocks. empanadas always rock so no surprise there.i recommend splitting the stuffed french toast- too rich and decadent for one person to handle alone.overall a fun, unique, and yummy experience.

ñoo boken! I loved it! I am from Miami and must say this is true Cuban food, we had some pastries, Cuban coffee and toast. I saw the plates around me and all looked great! Had I not been visiting I would have grabbed a plate! I just have so many options in Miami to choose and preferred to save the stomach space for some tasty Italian pasta and Pizza!

My father-in-law is ending his stay in Hoboken for work, and one of the saddest things about it is that we may not be going back to La Isla again for quite some time :(.  This cute, tucked in little Cuban diner / brunch restaurant has been a staple in all of our trips to Hoboken / NYC over the last two years.  As you can see from my attached pictures, this place is certainly on Food Network's radar, too.Located just 2-3 blocks from the Hudson River Walk and PATH station, the can't miss items are definitely the Huervoes Rancheros and the coffee.  Strong stuff!  Most recently I also dined on the Cuban toast and the Cappuccino, which was equally as delightful as the coffee.

TRY IT! Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum, yum. Absolutely LOVE La Isa. While this SMALL haunt is not recommended for big parties or those looking to linger, the flavors are FANTASTIC and the prices are not bad either (especially the lunch specials). While everything is good I recommend anything with pulled beef (sorry vegetarians). Feeling adventurous, close your eyes and run your finger up and down the menu, order what you land on (and barring any dietary restrictions) I'd be willing to bet you'd be more then satisfied. Just don't forget to wash it down with some BYOB and finish the culinary delight with the tres leche cake. Tips: Those in the know start off their day with La Isla's top notch, ridiculously cheap, coffee

We may not be able to (legally) get Cuban cigars, but we can get tasty and affordable Cuban food, which I'd much rather have anyway.You don't need a boat to get to La Isla (well, most of the time anyway...this IS Hoboken we're talking about) just your own two legs.Once you get there, you're greeted by...well, no one really. It's a bit confusing. Do you seat yourself? Does someone seat you? I still am really not sure. I usually get carryout.And the main downfall of La Isla is the service. It's not bad; it's generally accurate and timely. But it's also rather aloof.The food though? It's good and it's all pretty reasonably priced. Portions are generous, everything tastes great! Some of my favorites are the Media Noche (sandwich), the moro (black beans & rice w/ pork).Well I wouldn't say don't go eat here, it's really not a BAD place to GO. But I prefer to row up to La Isla and get my food to go eat on the open water.
Came here once and I got hooked. You must have their traditional Cuban sandwich , it brought me back memories . The only downfall they tend to run out of there Cuban sandwiches :( .

I've lived in Hoboken for about 6 months and I've been here or ordered take out countless times already.  It is consistently delicious.  The yellow rice and black beans are second to none, and the tostones are insanely good - ask for extra mojo sauce on the side because damn you can never have enough of that garlicky goodness.  And definitely try the pork chops - they are juicy, ridiculously flavorful and the caramelized onions on top are heavenly.Also this place is surprisingly accommodating for families.  We have a baby and a toddler and we've never had trouble eating brunch here, which is apparently their busiest time.  Coffee is great.  Omelettes are good.  The famous Omar's french toast is delicious but really heavy...be ready to share.  Delivery is fast and friendly.  My only complaint is one time I had a lot of trouble ordering on the phone - I think they were busy, but I was put on hold for a long time and I think they forgot about me.  Ended up listening to the kitchen staff chat in Spanish for a while.  But I called back and got another person and it was fine.

I love going to La Isla restaurant when I go to Hoboken, NJ.  The food are DARN  DELICIOUS. I have no regrets every time I come go there.  The waiters are pretty cool and friendly. The food is the real reason why I go.  I always order garlic chicken with black beans and Yucca.    Other foods that I have tried are dangerous delicious. I hope that the manager will re-consider to have a La Isla Restaurant in Las Vegas,NV.

Visiting my best friend who lives in Hoboken she suggested this place for lunch knowing how much I love Spanish cuisine. My toddlers loves the empanadas and shrimp in garlic cream sauce. I enjoyed the ropa vieja, so flavorful! This place has superb service, clean, pretty and delicious food. The music added to the ambience. Must try!

I'm so glad my boyfriend has been living in NJ for such a long time.  He rarely recommends this place - only because of how busy it gets.  We arrived at 10:20 on a Sunday, and almost every seat was taken.  (They open at 10...see what he means?)So, we sat outside.  He ordered 'la papa' and I had 2 eggs with home fries and toast.  He said la papa was delicious, and I tasted a non-meat section of it.  It was really cool how the potato had no skin and yet had a crispy outside.  The salad that came with it had a delicious dressing, too.My eggs were good, and the home fries were GREAT.  My only complaint was that a couple of pieces were gritty, hinting that the taters could've been washed a little more.  But hey, that's the risk you run with using red potatoes...and grit or not, I [heart] red potatoes.  Other complaint - their 'wheat toast' is neither wheat (it's multigrain) nor toast (it's partially toasted, mostly bread).  One more on the plus side - freshly squeezed orange juice!  Mmm.La papa, the salad, the OJ, and the home fries = a 4-star vote.

This place reminds me of a spot I'd find on Calle Ocho in Miami. I grew up on Caribbean/Cuban eats and it definitely lived up to my expectations. I've always been shy to order huevos racheros for some reason, but I didn't regret taking the risk here one bit. So delicious and filling, you won't even want to look at more food for the rest of the day! Hueveos rancheros here were a healthy portion of rice and black beans, crispy tortilla, and two perfected poached eggs. I am especially picky about my beans, but La Isla's were perfect, not over/undercooked or salty, not too saucy either. Whatever combination of flavors they had going on really worked. The spicy tomato sauce topping off the dish was the best added kick. My friend enjoyed the famous stuffed french toast, filled with guava and crusted with corn flakes. I was skeptical by the combo, but I found it very tasty. The guava cream cheese seemed to cut down on the sweetness and added a savory note which I liked. Definitely worth trying, but I would highly, highly recommended sharing the large portion.Get here before noon to enjoy their breakfast specialties!

Went here for brunch on a Sunday, which is apparently the most popular time to go. Ordered the poached eggs over shredded steak. Delicious and a HUGE portion. Could barely finish it. It also came with rice and beans, which were phenomenal. Ordered a side of the famous cornflake crusted french toast. It was okay. I wasn't a huge fan of the guava paste inside. I wouldn't order it again. (Tip: make sure to eat it fast and while it's still hot. Otherwise the exterior gets hard as a rock)MUST GET: the orange juice with milk. DELICIOUS. Tastes like a creamsicle. I would order this again and again. Wait time at 1pm on a Sunday was about 15 minutes. Not bad. They work hard to make sure the tables turn over quickly.

Ehhhhhhhh, so I came here many years ago and remember it being really really good! Convinced my boyfriend to come have a nice "hole in the wall" dinner. Ummmm I was disappointed to say the least , our waiter didn't feel like he wanted to be there, and when we asked for recommendation he just read us the menu. I ordered the grilled chicken with spinach and cream sauce, my honey ordered vaca frita. We ordered and it was out in no more than 5 min. My chicken tasted burnt! Not grilled I couldn't taste the sauce or anything because of burnt flavor was overpowering. The vaca frita is very thin, so if it's not made fresh you can see and taste it. It was hard and dry! When the waiter asked about our food i was very honest, his response was you should of told me right away so I could have said something. I wanted to say " welllllllllll if you ever came to check on us, I would have told your miserable ass!" They took the chicken off our bill, so I threw them a bone and gave them one star. The price did not match the portions, and I didn't get the real Cuban feel I got years ago. If you want real good cheap Cuban food go to Rumba Cubana or Gran Via in Union City. At some point this place lost what made them so special, what a shame.

Didn't get a chance to try their famous french toasts as on Saturday they are served only till 12:00 for breakfast not after that. Overall the food was good. Papa Rellena was big, awesome and can be shared between two people. The stuffed chicken habanero was amazing. The chorizo+shrimp skewers were good too.  I was recommended the steak sandwich by the waitress and I didn't like it at all. It was too dry. Hence, I had to knock off one star from the rating. The service here was not great as it was crowded but no complaints as the food was good.

Excellent Cuban food for breakfast lunch and dinner.  I highly recommend this place for breakfast.   On a Saturday/Sunday morning, this place is usually packed.  The food is excellent.  I have eaten the stuffed french toast (featured on that Bobby Flay show) and the Spinach and Plantain omelette, both were fantastic.  The coffee is great too.  Straight out of cuba!   For dinner, the Ropa Vieja is delicious.  Definitely give this place a try if you can get in a get a seat.  Make sure to put your name on the clipboard at the front.A+++++++++++++ Would eat again!

I've lived in South Florida pretty much all of my life and tried my share of Cuban food. I can honestly say this place serves arguably the best Cuban sandwich. The pork is delicious and the mojo sauce goes with the sandwich perfectly. The stuffed french toast here is also the best. Every bite of the french toast is bursting with sweet flavor. My girlfriend and I split both and the portions were such that both of us had a very full and satisfying meal.

Not really understanding the half hour wait on a Friday night. The place is small so you will easily have a wait on the weekends. The staff was nice enough but didn't go above and beyond...didn't seem to love their job. Smile! The food was average at best. Having had great Cuban food in jersey and miami (where cuban is king) the food was 2 and a half stars. The papa relleno was bland and just didn't taste right. The skirt steak wt chimichurri was fine. And the tasajo was pretty good. Nothing that Wowed any of us but it all edible...well, we didn't finish the papa rellenos. $70 for three people wasn't bad though.

I went to for breakfast at La Isla and was incredibly surprised with a cuisine that was totally foreign to me. I had Omar's stuffed french Toast which I highly recommend and I also had la Isla egg sandwich which was an absolute delight. The place was packed which made sense since the food is great and the prices were great for the quality of the food highly recommend this restaurant for a good filling breakfast.

La Isla has been written up countless times so I don't need to expand too much. I live in Hoboken for the last eight years, and I've ordered from la Isla  probably several hundred times, almost 1/2x per week. For breakfast, you can't go wrong with a simple scrambled eggs and toast with the Cuban coffee they serve.  everything is always served perfectly right.  My favorite, on occasion, is Omar's French toast, stuffed with a guava cream cheese filling that is to die for, with layers of strawberry and crusted with cornflake on the outside. You need to experience it to understand it, and unlike other places that do a similar entrée, the cream cheese guava jelly feelings does not overpower the dish.  I will usually get this, eat one of the slices, save the next for a snack or dessert later on. Just throw it in the toaster for one cycle and it's just as good as when you eat it fresh.For lunch I would have to recommend the cubano sandwich - although I must admit, once in a while it is exceptionally good when the bread is lightly toasted but fluffy inside, and the pulled pork is nice and juicy, but often times this sandwich isn't perfect when delivered, which is a shame because it really is exceptional when at its best.  Even when it's not on top of its game, it's still a great sandwich, and I usually use some of the hot sauce in the packets that they give you for a little extra kick.For lunch and dinner, I would recommend starters, the chicken empanadas, which are filled with pulled chicken but chunks as well, lightly toasted on the outside, really good, the croquet de jamon is good for a few bites each, and ice little mixture of some kind of ham and bread filling lightly fried on the outside, nice and tasty but not too heavy or too much.Dinner is pretty much throw a dart against the menu and you are good to go.  Their old meets are great, I usually go with the pulled pork, my favorite entrée special is the Ropa VIeja, which is April flank steak in a red sauce, it's really good, buttery soft, and Foursides I usually get white rice with Maduros, with a small red beans on the side as well.  Your entrée will come with a choice of two sides, but I like to add the third. This dinner will always last me at least two meals, sometimes three if I'm not starving. The leftovers are great, I usually throw everything together in a bowl, throw it in the microwave, and the flavors all complement each other so well.The mango cheesecake that they have for dessert is on another level, I actually have to force myself to go a month without ordering it because it got out of hand.  I love cheesecake and this mango cheesecake is one of the best ever.  Also, your coffee is some of the best in town, dark roast with a strong flavor, highly caffeinated, and they will serve it with milk Cuban style if you don't specify otherwise.Honestly, there is only one complaint I could ever serve against this restaurant, and that is the young man who mostly answers the phone to take phone orders. I always cringe when he picks up because he is rude and makes it awkward, especially since I order so often and he knows that, and I am always overly polite, you would think that he would be a little bit more polite.  whenever the women answer the phone, I am so relieved, which is weird because why should I feel uncomfortable when placing a phone delivery order, but he honestly makes it that weird, like he is annoyed having to take your food order.  it's not the biggest deal obviously, but since they are such nice people that own it, all of the people are so nice that work there, it's a very nice family vibe that you get there, so you would think that he would also keep that going as he is the face of the company to anybody who calls the place their order.  obviously not enough to stop me from ordering twice a week, that would be great if he could maybe chipper up a little bit lol, he should be enthusiastic about selling what I consider to be the best cooked food in town.

Excellent food!   Love the garlic shrimp dish as well as the chicken and steak sandwiches.  The place itself is TINY but gets extremely busy which can cause long waits (especially during lunch time).  The staff is mostly friendly.   Something cool to mention is this place has been on Food Network twice and won Bobby Flay on a Throw Down with their breakfast dish!

Amazing cuban coffee/ diner this is my go to spot for authentic Cuban food. The appetizers, salads and entrées are all top notch, but the breakfast is even better. Always crowded and usually a wait but that's to be expected from here, handled well by professional staff.

Not that I'm an expert when it comes to Cuban food (let's be serious here, I'm from Canada - just about as far as you can get from Cuba), but this place is legit! It's super small inside, so lineups and wait times can be long, but it's definitely worth it.I started with the beef empanada, which came out within minutes and was hot and fresh. It was so expertly seasoned that you could easily enjoy it with no hot sauce or salsa - in fact, even though I tried it with the green hot sauce (yowza!) I ate most of it naked, because the flavor was just too good to mess with.As an entree I got the Churrasco con Chimichurri, medium rare, and to my surprise, it actually came out medium rare! Not only was it cooked to perfection, but it was seasoned beautifully and the green sauce on the side? USE IT. For the love of all things holy, use it! Smother that meat in delicious green sauce and put it in your mouth. There. I said it. On the side I got black beans (a little sloppy, more wet than beany) and fried green plantains, which were garlicky and all kinds of delicious.Service was fast without being unfriendly and we didn't feel hurried to finish, even though the place has very few tables and people were waiting at the door. Definitely a must-try in the Hoboken area.

This place is just fantastic. It is a no frills cuban restaurant and I have not had anything on the menu I do not like. Let me just remind you it is NO FRILLS... The service is always there, but you're not getting 5 star treatment. They get you whatever you need/want. The food is amazing! I still sometimes think about their pork chops while I'm laying awake in bed. They were SO juicy and delish AND you get 2 so basically you get 2 dinners. I always eat one and take the other home for the next day. I can  never decide which beans are better... the black or the red as they are both phenom. The red ones are SUPER salty (which I like) Its BYOB so the price stays low and they always have specials for certain days of the week. And their brunch is also amazing.Expect a wait during high volume dinner and brunch times... there is no spot to wait really so its outside or crammed up front.
Great brunch. Have to try the French toast special...simply amazing. Huevos rancheros is another great choice. Definitely worth a return trip.

This place is always packed whenever I go and requires a 10-minute wait for seating. They're one of the few places on Washington Street serving breakfast, which is great if you want something more filling than Dunkin Donuts. The other reviews have already covered pretty much everything I could say. The food is great, the portions are big but not overwhelming, and the staff is very thoughtful (if extremely busy, but who can blame them?). I really enjoy their brunches: fluffy omelets, strip steak and eggs, sweet plantains, even their French toast is good.Only downside, the place is a little small. Good for a small group but anything over 3 people and you'll feel cramped.

Hoboken never ceases to amaze me. Cuban!?Food is good, that's a given by now if you've read enough reviews.The place is kinda tight. As soon as you walk in, sign up for a seat. There's a clipboard on the left. There's nowhere to really wait for your seat that won't make you feel...awkward though. I'm sure we could have waited outside and the waitress would have called out into the street for us though.It's BYOB, which is awesome...especially since there is a liquor store a few buildings down north.It's a very homey feel. Very mom & pop.Order the maduros...you always gotta order the maduros when you're eatin' Cuban. So order the maduros.I had the Pollo Habanero and thought it was very good and well made. $16 though.I would go again...all the time if I lived in Jersey City/Hoboken.But if I lived in Jersey City, I'd probably be at Hardgrove Cafe all the time...so, if I lived in Hoboken I'd go here all the time.Yeah, Hoboken.And maybe twice every week. Not, all the time.Yeah, there we go.

You can read about the authentic Cuban food in the other reviews on this page. I'm here to talk about their absolutely delicious, eye rolling, lip smacking key lime pie. I could eat this pie for the rest of eternity. It's just the right amount of tart and so delicate. I still dream about this pie, I'm such a huge fan of pie, and Isla hit the spot.If you go and have dessert, skip the flan. Get the pie, savor it, let the flavor develop on your tongue. It's so damn delicious. Completely worth the $13 toll from NYC.

Excellent little hole in the wall. Big fan of their poached eggs in taco shells with spicy sauce, rice, and beans. The coconut shakes (with milk) are delicious. Please is a great value, but expect to wait for a table for brunch, and if you show up on Saturday, they will stop serving breakfast promptly at noon.

We came for breakfast and it was pretty good. I had the spinach omelette with maduros (sweet plaintains). I never would have thought about this combo but I actually enjoyed it.  We also tried the famous stuffed French toast.  It tastes pretty good but it is very sweet.  If you are not used to having dessert for breakfast, than you may not like it.  The place is small so it may seem crowded.  We came early Sunday morning so we didn't have a problem.  The coffee was good as a Cuban place should always have.  :) no complaints

Been here a few times over the years. Went here for dinner on Sunday since we were in the area and we actually were able to find a parking spot a few blocks away. Me and the wife both had the lechon. The pork was soo moist and flavorful. It fell apart at the touch of the fork...outstanding! I was a bit disappointed at the price of the rice and black beans I ordered for my son. I thought $6.50 was a little bit of a high price for this. I also noticed the empanadas were $3.50. I guess I'm just used to the lower prices at some of the Union City Cuban restaurants. Other than that, everything was great and service was good.

Went here for dinner, had the Cuban sandwich as an appetizer. It was really good and really big. My boyfriend and I both had steaks for dinner. They were good, nothing too special. The brunch menu looks really good though, I would definitely go back to try it out.

For what this spot is, I just can't get enough. It was packed last night, me and the man sat at the counter, brought a bottle of red, ordered the seafood empanadas, and split a steak and a chicken sandwich. Awesome.I love it , I would have given it 5 stars, but the chicken sandwich wasn't as great as the steak sandwich.  I STILL HEART  THIS PLACE and one of my favorite spots in all of the boroughs and Hoboken and JC.Love, love, love

So today my girlfriend and I decided to try la isla restaurant. This place is very small and we waited for about 20 min for a table. We ordered papa rellena, and tostones con mojo for appetizer. The papa rellena is amazing it was ball stuffed with potato and meat. For our entree I had the churrasco con chimichurri. The best skirt steak I ever had. My girlfriend ordered the pork chops, it came out so perfect. This place is definitely worth going so if you want some good Cuban food besides Cuban Pete's than come here. Oh ya everyone there was very nice and treated us like family.

This review is strictly for breakfast- I had the famous stuffed French toast and iced Cuban latte. Omg truly worth the fame. I have a pretty big sweet tooth but could only finish one piece of the french toast before lapsing into a diabetic coma, in a good way of course. It is the culinary equivalent of "a lady in the street but a freak in the bed"- the contrasts make it so enticing. Crunchy crust, gooey filling, a little salty, very sweet. The latte was not playing around either- strong coffee and fatty milk. Well worth an early rise for breakfast- served every day till 11.

Muy delicioso. I've been living in Hoboken for 3 years and just came to La isla for the first time for brunch today. There was a line of people formed outside of the door just waiting for the 10 am opening. That's how popular it is- so get here as early as possible to avoid a long wait. Great menu selection of simple, traditional Cuban favorites. Today I was craving savory so I ordered the "el balsero" (poached eggs with shredded flank steak over rice with a side of beans) but I plan to come back for the famous French toast. I had a bite of the chorizo sandwich, which was fantastic. Add a Cuban latte to your meal and you have one fulfilling brunch.

Despite the Food Network hype and endorsements that can tend to draw more obnoxious tourists than locals,  La Isla is a go-to, solid local choice for consistent, tasty dishes and high quality ingredients. It's my #1 casual choice in Hoboken for a no-frills BYOB brunch, lunch or dinner.  Although I have never been to Cuba, stepping inside this restaurant makes me feel like I've been transported into a local Cuban neighborhood diner. Welcomed by pleasant, upbeat Cuban music and colorful decor, you'll enter a cozy diner-like space. Yes, the service is apathetic but that's a part of the charm if you ask me.Favorites include the Cubano sandwich (with extra pickles and habanero sauce), Huevos Rancheros, papaya smoothie, and the stuffed french toast. The Cuban bread is also divine, so always make sure you get a basket when you come here! The desserts are excellent as well.
Dont matter where you located in the north east you have to pass by and try their gourmet food i love this place.

I don't want to sound like a homer to tout my own neighborhood's joint, but this is really the only place I go to regularly in Hoboken.  Latin food is one of faves and I love rice.  I usually seek out many Latin joints up in West New York and Bergenline Blvd, but nothing beats La Isla's flavored rice dishes.  It doesn't matter if it's a simple pollo asado dish or camarones al ajillo or spared ribs, the many different types of dishes I've had here are simple and delicious and cost-effective.  Long wait times must be expected during lunch time on weekends.  And their Cuban sandwiches are average, but positives outweigh negatives by plenty at this joint.To La Isla family, do not ever expand or open another location, just stay small and stay great and continue churning out awesome food!

I lived in Miami for 3 years so believe me when I say this place is completely legit.  I've eaten here at least half a dozen times.Great food for dinner, great cafe con leches.  The only problem is that its hard to get a table because its so tiny.  (Being on Food Network didn't help with that either.)Absolutely worth a try.

I'm a frequent visitor because this place is great for lunch or dinner. Seared salmon or garlic chicken are good entrées. Their famous papa rellena app is also a must. Seating is limited due to size so it can fill up quick.

Hoboken seems like one of the least likely places that would be known for a good Cuban breakfast. It appears that there is no end to this city's surprises because the breakfast here makes this one of best spots around.I've been here several times over the years and I usually steer more towards the more traditional Cuban dishes but I didn't know what to expect when I tried their version of french toast. Apparently it was featured on the Food Network's Throwdown with Bobby Flay. They call it Omar's stuffed french toast. All I know is that is was delicious. Two pieces of powdered French toast dipped in cinnamon batter, coated with corn flakes, almonds, and stuffed with strawberries and guava cream cheese. Everything was a happy blend of satisfying goodness.I've also had the omelettes here as well. You get your choice of three fillings. I usually go with chorizo, manchego cheese, and onions. A side of platanos maduros provides a great compliment to it. The home fries here are amazing too. They don't phone it in like a lot of places do with home fries.  Another tasty thing to try here are their specialty beverages they call batidos. It's their version of  a shake made with milk and ice. Being half PR, I tend to love anything made with coconut. The coconut batido is here is fantastic. I think you lose your latin restaurant license if you don't make a good cafe con leche. Of course, it goes without saying that they do a pretty good one here. The only wish I have for this place is to expand their menu a bit. The amount of items listed aren't very many. I guess it's not really hurting their business because I'm told that this place gets pretty packed during the day and especially on weekends. Be prepared for an hour wait at times. Luckily, I didn't run into that problem because I came in on a weekday morning and it opens really early. I came in around 7am and had the place all to myself. I can easily be woken up by the thought of great food. The latin music blaring at this joint also helps a little too.

This Sunday morning it was up and attem for the door opening of La Isla's 10am brunch and it was worth the early start. The restaurant opened it's doors 2 min early to allow a line of 15 diners in. It was much appreciated as the limited seating was gobbled up and the smell of fried eggs and Cuban lattes filled the air. My girlfriend and I were fortunate enough to get prime seating at the counter top, where we were immediately waited on by the "Noboken" shirt wearing staff. From, host, waitress and bus boy everyone was super friendly and patient as we phonetically figured our way through each order. I opted for the Choripan(a delicious chorizo sandwich with caramelized onions and potato hash) while my girlfriend had the delectable El balsero (pulled beef, rice and beans with two poached eggs). Each dish tasted as good as it's presentation. The fresh soft Cuban bread really made the experience of my breakfast sandwich, while my girlfriend, full and satisfied, resisted the urge to take her meal home for fear of eating it all day long. The quality and taste of this outing demands atleast one follow up visit to try out The Bobby Flay Throw Down dish; stuffed French toast. From what I could see in the 45 min we were there, it's insanely populate, as expected and looks delicious. Combined with great pricing, this literal hole in the wall is worth the time and energy for some great Cuban food. I look forward to getting back to La Isla and recommend all those with a sense of culinary adventure or a healthy appreciation for honest Cuban short order. And don't forget to take a overstuffed beef empanada to go.

This is a really delicious little spot you may accidentally walk by, but once you know it is there, you probably won't go anywhere else. No wonder why Guy from Diner Drive In and Dives loves this place. I've never gotten Cuban food anywhere.

We stopped in her yesterday on a whim.    I ordered the Ensalada de Espinaca y Remolacha with chicken.   It was the perfect salad with flavorful chicken, chopped macadamia nuts, avocado, citrus, and a bit of blue cheese.   My husband ordered the chicken in garlic sauce - also amazing!

My family that lives in Hoboken had been wanting to try La Isla, so when my husband and I were visiting and we went and loved it!!! I ordered the La Papa and it was delicious!! My husband had the regular french toast and it was also delicious. The restaurant is small and the whole party must be present before they will seat you. The service is quick and we will be back on our next visit. A must try Cuban cuisine!!

This Place and it's food is Just Married With Flavor, Just Across the City in One Short ride in the Path ($2.75) you'd be in a Great Area with Chill avant Garde Atmosphere that has a variety of other places to enjoy after dinner or even to Explore other Restaurants (LAs Olas  restaurant just up the street, On Tuesdays have a Special deal on Tacos) , One of them is this Cuban Restaurant. Anything and everything is Super Tasty!!! Diner Drive ins and Dives was here and They Loved it too!! It's a Locals Favorite (Ropa Vieja)
AMAZING!!! The service is good but the food is even better. The roasted chicken is so good and the Bistek de Palomilla is to die for!

One of the best breakfasts/ coffee I've ever had. Only go or 4/5 due to size of restaurant, makes it a little uncomfortable to eat. One of the best descriptions of "hole in the wall" ever.I had to update my review BC after continuously going here it has to be one of my favorite Hoboken finds- 5 stars!
Good food, but over priced and too packed.  The place is too tiny as well.  Perhaps you will enjoy it more for take out.

I had the grilled chicken lunch plate. Its not big so if you have a large appetite maybe you should order the Entree. The breast and wing where full of herby and garlicky flavor but it was dry. It comes with grilled garlicky onions on top and 2 sides. I had it with black beans and yucca. The beans are awesome full of flavor, the yucca is boiled and with chopped garlic on top, it was pretty tasty but I was picturing fried yucca as it doesn't specify on the menu. The white rice is just plain no spices, oil or flavor, but I like that because it combined well with everything else. I took a star away because my food was cold and they had to rewarm it and that took long. My husband had the Cuban club sandwich and he said it wasn't all that maybe because it was cold. :(*a plus this is a BYOA restaurant.

I'm subtracting a star because Guy Fieri was here. I fucking hate Guy Fieri. Any place cursed with the misfortune of hosting him needs to be exorcised so the douchebaggery and grease will not leave a permanent stain. That being said...My boyfriend and I had a late lunch there on Saturday (10/12), and the food was delicious. I ordered the croqueta preparada sandwich; he ordered the Saturday special (not sure what it was, but I tried some and it tasted like chicken to me). We sat at the bar and observed the activity as we ate (I've been here about three times and it doesn't matter when you go, it's always busy). I don't know what they do to their bread, but I love the consistency of it: crisp on the outside and mealy on the inside.We almost finished our sandwiches, but alas, our appetites failed us. However, I will visit La Isla again in the future (hopefully the stench from Guy Fieri's hair gel will have subsided by then).
Me and my 20+ friends came here last wk for some incredible Cuban food. The churrasca was delish. Portions were huge and the restaurant was cozy. Everyone was satisfied!

I loved everything about this place. I came here in the middle of the afternoon so I opted for lighter faire and just ordered a Cuban sandwich with a side of tostones. Well, this was not "lighter faire" because the portions were huge! The food was awesome so I was glad there was plenty of it. I really wanted to try the entrees because they all sounded great and were originally what drove me here. My only complaint is that the tostones did not come with enough ajo! That's the best part! Overall, this place is authentic, great food, reasonable prices, and I will definitely go back if I am in the area again, especially to try the entrees.

This place looks teeny-tiny, but don't be fooled, they always seem to have just enough room. It's so cute and colorfully-painted inside, and has a casual and calm atmosphere.We've been twice in the last week - so that should tell you how much we like it. First time we went, we had the papa relleno (before realizing it was the signature dish). I want to go back to have just one of these, because a fried ball of diced meat and mashed potatoes sounds like a full meal to me. And would therefore allow me to not feel bad about finishing it.The chicken with garlic sauce is beyond amazing. I could pour that sauce on my cereal in the morning, that's how yummy it is. The grilled chicken comes on spinach and even my greens-avoiding boyfriend was all over it. Like we fought over who got the last of the sauced-up spinach. The second time we came was during the lunch rush and we got a cubano (and another papa relleno). It was good but we wished we'd gotten an entree instead after our garlic chicken bliss.The service is attentive and welcoming, the food is great, and the ambiance is perfect. I don't know if it's BYOB, but it really doesn't matter. That's how good the food is.

One of the BEST cuban sandwiches i have ever had! Restaurant is really small and they do not take reservations but it is well worth the wait! Good for brunch and dinner plus it is BYOB! All around great place!
They changed the recipe for the tres leches and it's for the worst. Still good but not the most amazing must have every time I'm in Hoboken kind of thing. I'll pass next time.

I was really excited to try this place after reading the raving reviews. I have to say its good but not amazing. Papa Rellena - 3/5Pap Rellena with the salsa ranchera (note theres a 1.00 surcharge for the salsa) - 3.5/5The salsa Ranchera is missing a kick. It's good but not great. El Cubano - 3.5/5 Bread was perfect but the pork was too dry and not flavourful at all.Roasted chicken thigh Pollo Asado with yellow rice and Black Beans - 3.5/5  Have you ever tried Sophie's in NYC because La Isla's version is like a healthy version of Sophie's. The yellow rice was not as good as Sophie's. The chicken leg was really flavorful no complaints there. The black beans was also meh compared to Sophie's.Maybe La Isla is the best restaurant in Hoboken? I don't live in Hoboken but was there for a day trip. Will I dine at this restaurant again?Yes to try the French Toast seen on the TV show Throwdown.

This place is small and unassuming... However, it has the down-home feel of a diner -- but for amazing CUBAN food! For brunch, I always go for the Omar's French Toast! Cannot go wrong with that! They have great daily specials as well. Great for takeout, delivery and if you can find seating, it is the best experience!

Thoroughly enjoyed the cubano sandwich there recently with a tasty mug of black coffee.  It's a small local place offering great tasting, authentic, Cuban food. Service is great and with a smile too -- which makes it even better. Highly recommend this restaurant in the Hoboken area!

Greatttt food----I've been here a few times and I have never been Disappointed. I've had various dishes and all good. My children like the food here to and they are picky eaters.The place is small and gets really busy. I would still wait for a table or just sit at the counter for my food. Whatever you decide to do take out or stay it won't disappoint at all.
The Churassco is always on point. Everything else I have had at this place is very well executed. Perfect dive for Cuban food.
I loved this place. The food was amazing. The people were super friendly. Def recommend this place for Cuban food.

3.5 stars. La Isla is a great little place that is a staple in the Hoboken restaurant scene.  I usually order the same thing every time I go there... Cuban sandwich... They have it down, they're just good at making this classic.  Love going on a Saturday afternoon and eating at the counter.  Cool spot.

7 Steps to Eternal Cuban Bliss:Step 1: Grab a table outside. (Weather permitting, obvi.)Step 2: Order a cafe con leche.Step 3: Delight in its magical creaminess.Step 4: Order Papa Rellena.Step 5: Sprinkle liberally with hot sauce and stuff your face.Step 6: Order Flan de Leche.Step 7: Gorge yourself.You're welcome and I love you, too.
Really amazing stuffed french toast. Have also had their eggs- delicious! Have not eaten in as we always get take-out when I am here. Will be back!

Went here Sunday for brunch...got there around 11:45 waited maybe 3 minutes before seats opened up at the counter. The coffee is a amazing! El Balsero is a must try!!! Very cool spot, everything looked and smelled amazing! Can't wait to go back and try more!

This is my go to spot when I need to have an early morning meeting near the Path. The staff is always wonderful and their coffee is outstanding. Maybe the best in Hoboken. My favorite is their regular french toast. It's always so consistent and  I love that they top it with sliced almonds. Plus they have real maple syrup.

This is a review only for brunch. My mother and I went to check things out with high expectations and left disappointed. The stuffed french toast was way too sweet and the juevos rancheros were tasty, but really nothing special. The only positive was the coffee - which was spectacular.

I've been here twice now and can say I definitely prefer the dinner food over brunch. I realize the stuffed french toast is "semi"-famous but it didn't do it for me. The cream cheese was overkill and overall, the french toast was dry, despite having strawberry sauce drizzled over the top.As for the chuletas- amazing. I'd order them every single time. The juicy, marinated chops and caramelized onions (with maduro and beans of course) make this dish heaven on a plate.

Always crowded so be prepared to wait if you have more than two people, also.. don't come here with more than 4, it's tiny so I am not sure they could accommodate you. With that said.. the food is fantastic! I get the egg sandwich every time (it's that good) and my bf switches things up each time, the few times I have brought guests here I get phone calls once they leave telling me they're craving the cuban coffee from La Isla.. so that is definitely worth a try!! BYOB, which is always nice :) love it here and come often for take out! It's worth the wait and walk up there if you can stand to wait to eat your food until you get home!

LOVE! I've been here twice and love it. Both times I've been here was crowded but didn't take too long to be seated. Bar seating is available if tables are taken. The price of the food isn't bad and the food I got was delish. In my opinion, the serving sizes are big. Just wished this place was a little bigger but can't do anything about that.

Enjoyed this little gem very much.  Delicious specials included appetizer of lobster bits, and a pork chop with perfect lightly spicy sauce (although the plate was cold, and so were the veggies). The Salmon was delicious atop a a bed of black bean risotto. Definitely will visit again!

As far as Cuban food in Hoboken goes, this is the best you will find.  They have an amazing cuban sandwich for when you are in a hurry or just stopping in for a quick bite.  The rest of their menu is great, I love the soup, empanadas, and the croqueta.  The rest of the menu is an amazing comfort food.  The steaks or the pork chops are just divine, you simply cannot go wrong.  Just come in hungry.

I'd been a loyal customer since the beginning when La Isla was just a hole in the wall with amazing food at affordable prices. I recently paid a visit after many years and found the food to still be amazing. You really can't go wrong with the menu here. Just be prepared for sticker shock. For what they charge, you can go find yourself a nicer restaurant with the same if not better tasting menu. I need to discover another hole-in-the-wall or hit one of the nicer Cuban places in Hoboken.

This review is for take-out.Got the famous stuffed french toast... YUMMY!!!!! It came with 2 pieces and I could only eat one. It was sweet,  more like a dessert. I didn't even need maple syrup. I'll be back to dine-in, and I'll up date this review  :)

Went there with Cuban buddy of mine, and he ordered up a storm so I could try a bunch of different stuff.  First, we started with beef empanada and ham croquet.  Next we split the Omar's Stuffed French Toast.  I am normally not a fan of Bobby Flay or anything he endorses, but this one hit the mark.  It was stuffed with cream cheese, strawberries, and guava, and battered with corn flakes.  Oh man was it good. For the main course we both got Cuban sandwiches.  These things were huge.  Considering we were trying everything on the menu, we should have split one.  It definitely was enough.  And for dessert (that's right, dessert) we tried these empanadas with stuffed with fruit and cheese.  Similar to the French toast, but still pretty awesome.  Top all that off with a cafe con leche, and the whole experience was complete.  I understand that this place can get a little crazy, but I would say it was worth the wait.

As one of the few authentic spanish places in the area it's descent you can get better food taste quality and price wise outside of hoboken but not bad the prices could be better but considering its hoboken and the staff can be rude at times

We ate here on a Friday night.  We walked from the Westin in Jersey City along the waterfront, which was a nice 20 minute walk.  Although La Isla wasn't what we were looking for, we were pleasantly surprised.  The restaurant is tiny and narrow, with a counter and a single row of seating on the inside.  The food here was very good.  I had pork chops with black beans and plantain maduros; my wife had steak and my son had chicken.  The server was very helpful and attentive.  We would definitely eat here again.

I work down the street from this place. I usually order lunch. Good food. They have it ready pretty quick. Love their steak sandwiches. Their prices are also very reasonable. Nice to have some good Cuban food in the area. The only complaint I have is sometimes delivery takes forever.

I eat here more for breakfast now than dinner (although the dinner is still top notch).Get the Huevos Rancheros. They're presented beautifully and they taste as good as they look. The batidos beverage is also quite tasty. Wife loves the coconut.Warning on their caffeinated beverages: cuban coffees tend to be super strong. Be careful or you'll have the jitters all morning.

I'm born and raised in Hoboken and have now been in this town for 27 years. I've been eating at La Isla for a LONG time and lately; it's been a HUGE disappointment.The quality of the food has been declining over the past 3-4 years while the prices are growing exponentially; not the ideal equation we'd want to see as consumers. The influx of yuppies has definitely hurt this place; they now think they can serve below average food for well above average prices. I suggest the Cuban which has a MUCH BETTER ATMOSPHERE and great customer service for the same price as this outdated cafeteria-style hole-in-the-wall.Not to mention, they run out of food ALL THE TIME - seriously - that's how they run the business.Anyway, I digress, if you're looking for the authentic feel, go just about anywhere else in Union City or North Bergen.

I love this place! Fun, fun, fun! One of my favorite restaurants anywhere, and I am an Italian gourmet cook, a hardcore "foodie" and a big wine collector. At 12th and Maxwell Lane, this is simply great Cuban food with a hip bar scene and excellent service. The crowd is a mix of young and older. In a market over served by Italian and steak restaurants, this is simply a great find. The new uptown space is airy and bright with a Cuban flair and a lively, fun crowd. They have kept the casual feel of the downtown La Isla (which is still going strong) upfront but have created a much more upscale dining area in the back. Go, order the garlic chicken (over the top) or anything else for that matter. It's all great at a reasonable price. Finally Omar, the chef, has been featured on the Food Network twice, and the owners are simply the best. Worth the boat trip from Manhattan as it is a short walk from the 14th St. NY Waterway ferry. Go and this authentic Cuban hot spot will forever be on your short list.

Absolutly delicious.  For breakfast the La Isla Huevos Rancheros is on par with any i have ever had and  Omar's Stuffed French Toast is top notch.  Cafe con leche is tasty and reasonable priced.  For lunch the empanadas are above average and the pap rellena is delicious. Any of the daily much specials are really good and are a good value. The staff does their job. I really could not be more pleased and I often go out of my way to eat here.

Hmm looks like this section of Hoboken has become food network and tourist territory. They have taken over.  Across the street is the cake boss with its long line.  La Isla fortunate for us doesn't have but its damn near close. Some brunch morning, I end just taking the path to the west village due to the line.When I finally did have the stuffed French toast it was a waterfall of flavors. Sweet and delectable Fruit, Guava, Strawberry, cheese, cream cheese. The French toast is topped with corn flakes with healthy crunch on the outside and creamy on the inside. After eating this comfort delight you will need to join planet fitness in hobo. This dish cost the prices of a month's membership anyway.

An impressive little Cuban restaurant. Emphasis on little, just so you know. But there's seating outside and there always seems to be a table open here - it's like some kind of freak magic has enchanted this place to ensure ample seating at all times.Service is quick and they're all so friendly.The food is fantastic. For breakfast, I've had the stuffed french toast (mmmm, to die for!) - egg bread filled with strawberry guava cream cheese and layered with cinnamon batter sprinkled with corn flakes & almonds - it's SO good. For dinners, I've always stuck to the papa rellena for my appetizer (mashed potato stuffed w/ ground meat and mega-crispy!) and the steak / chicken sandwiches. Everything is prepared well and super zesty.Highly recommended. If you're into Cuban or are considering trying - this is your stop! It's right on Washington and near the PATH for easy accessibility.

No nonsense, just great food.  Believe the hype, the french toast is the best you'll ever eat.  Got there 15 minutes before opening because I we didn't know when it opened and 5 minutes later there was a line 20 deep.  One day I'll get around to trying other dishes but I can't resist getting the stuffed french toast every time.

This place definitely has the money to expand the tight quarters, but choose to keep it small, intimate, and authentic.Overall the food is pretty good. Is it the BEST Cuban food ever? Probably not. One food item that I can unequivocally say is the best I've ever had is the Omar's Stuffed French Toast. Every single person I've take here for brunch, who's tried the Stuffed French toast has said the same too! Yeah, it's THAT good! I'm not even the biggest french toast person in the world, but this is just ridiculously good!Sunday Brunch be prepared to wait. Get there early! Also, it's BYOB!In summary, OMAR'S STUFFED FRENCH TOAST is one of the greatest things my taste buds have ever enjoyed!Cheers!
Plantains.  Yummy Yummy plantains.  Great authentic and fresh Cuban food.  Tiny seating area but you can grab a stool and go solo.  Great salads.
The best cuban sandwich ever. The staff is really friendly, too. We kept going back to this small unassuming restaurant!

VERY impressed by this small little restaurant.came here for the day from new york to check out hoboken and it's restaurants.my boyfriend and i decided to stop here for lunch.what we ordered:pinchos de chorizo y camarones.oh MY, so flavorful. good chorizo is always such a plus for me.empenada de carne.beef empanada, was ABSOLUTELY delicious. would have been A tiny bitbetter if it was a little warmer, but honestly i don't think it even matteredthe flavor was outstanding.ensalada de berro.watercress, avocado, fried yucca, tomatolight and delicious salad, nice and refreshing dressingel cubano.oh the joy of a cuban sandwich made RIGHT.amazing. great flavor, one of the best if not the best cuban sandwichesi've ever had.service was very friendly.

I have been going here for for over 5 years and never had any problems at all. it usually always busy when i am there and the service is spot on. they all work together. sit at the counter for the best service. They have an excellent brunch. Stuffed french toast omelets you can create and the iced coffee is what real coffee should taste like, they have good cuban sandwiches and tasty desserts.
La Isla is awesome. The food's really good and you can't go wrong with any option. The only thing is the seating is limited but worth the wait.

I hope to change my review in the future and please note this is only based on the service and not the food. My party and I attended Las Islas on Saturday night and waited to be seated, only to be told the kitchen would be closing before we could sit down. We attempted to clarify the confusion but the staff members appeared eager to go home.  We decided to leave in order to avoid further frustration. Unfortunately they did not attempt to convince or further clarify the situation which diminished our interest in returning anytime soon. It appears this place has good food but they lack in customer service.
Awesome brunch spot. Haven't been here for dinner yet but brunch is on point. Good portion sizes with lots of options for everyone.

I've been to La Isla Restaurant quite a few times and although the food was good as always, I must say that I was a bit disappointed in the service. I went there for lunch one afternoon and although the restaurant was not packed, I couldn't help but feel rushed by my waiter. Now, I'm not one of those people who sits down and takes forever to eat so there was no reason for him to rush me. That was one reason I am giving it only one star. The second is because I was in Hoboken last night with some friends and wanted them to try the relleno de papas. Well, we had a hard time finding parking but when finally did we went straight to La Isla. We did not want to sit down and eat, we simply wanted a couple of relleno de papas. Well, we walked in at 9:48pm (they close at 10) and the heavy-set lady behind the counter rudely told us that they were closed. She didn't even bother to ask if she could help us with anything. She should not have assumed that we wanted a meal or to sit down and eat. What about if we simply wanted to purchase a bottle of water or dessert to go? We did not appreciate her being so rude and short with us. I am very big on good customer service and I've recommended La Isla to many people. I highly doubt that I will go back to this restaurant. The food is good but it's not so good that it's worth dealing with rude people. La Isla- being on Diner, Drive Ins, and Dives doesn't give you the right to be rude to your customers!

Love living right around the corner to La Isla... and pretty much anything I order from this place. Although I am not well versed in Cuban cuisine, I've eaten at several locally recommended Cuban food spots across the nation, and appreciate making this Hoboken recommendation. The Pan con Bistec has become my comfort food when I do not want to cook. The thin cut steak is lightly marinated with black pepper. This allows the pickled vegetables and chili to shine thought and create a hearty tasting sandwich. My friend had me try the Papa Rellena, which is now my favorite large snack. I will now eat tostones with butter. Yum. ... And now all I need is the NO! mug...
Overrated. Why so small? Why the ridiculous write-in reservation system? Once you get past how small the place is, the food is good enough.

Wow who knew there was such a great Cuban restaurant in Hoboken! And one that was on Throwndown with Bobby Flay. We came here for brunch on a nice Sunday afternoon and we only waited 10 minutes. Of course we ordered the Stuffed French Toast that was on the show and it was amazing! The outside was crispy with toasted almonds and the inside was filled with fresh strawberries and cream. I recommend that you share this because it's two pieces and can be overwhelming if you have both slices yourself. We also got the steak with eggs and rice and beans. The eggs were nothing special but the steak was nice and juicy and went really well with the lime and beans.I'm kicking myself because we forgot to try the flan.

I had high hopes for La Isla. Guy Fieri even paid a visit there. We had dinner there last night. We thought it was a perfect night to sit outside. Big mistake. A man who appeared to be homeless and drunk began harassing us and everyone sitting outside at La Isla. When none of the guests gave into his requests for money and his maniacal staring at the guests did not work, the man began to get irritated and starting yelling expletives (such as "suck my d***!") in front of the children and the rest of the guests sitting outside. What did the staff at La Isla do in response? Absolutely nothing. They just stared out the window at the man harassing all of their guests. We actually had to get up and go inside in the middle of our meal to get away from the harassment. When I asked a member of the La Isla staff to speak with a manager, he pointed at our waiter who was obviously not the manager. They did not do anything to accomodate us - in fact, they made us stand there uncomfortably for 15 minutes while they ran our credit card. The whole time, they continued to watch the man harass their guests through the window. This place is very poorly run and they do not care about repeat business. The food was average at best.

Went to dinner here a bit early on a Friday night after work. When we came in it was empty but during the hour or so we were there it quickly filled up. And I can see why. We split a chicken empanada to start - we weren't starving but wanted a little something to nibble on - and it was pretty perfect. It was not oily, the crust was fried lightly. And the filling was fresh and just enough spice. As always Byob is pretty clutch especially when the pricing is a little high. But we definitely got our money's worth. I had the go to triple D featured Tasajo Con Boniato. It was a great size portion and the flavors gelled together nicely.  I was nervous that it would be cliche and dated but it was delicious and I'm glad I ordered it. I would recommend it to anyone!We finished off with Cuban lattes and the tres leche cake. A little too much whipped cream for my liking but definitely hit the spot!

Quaint, friendly staff, tasty food, and reasonable prices. Empanadas are awesome, especially the beef. Phenomenal brunch menu - what can I say about the stuffed french toast that isn't already said, except that it's awesome and you have to try it.The BEST Cuban flan area, even including NYC. It's hard to find that creamy consistency that is specific to Cuban flan - not the ubiquitous tofu-like Spanish counterpart, but the one here is spot on. Entrees aren't the cheapest for what is a very casual restaurant atmosphere, however the portions are HUGE and more than make up for that. You can easily get 1-2 additional lunches out of one portion, especially if you get a rice as one of your two sides. If you're looking for someplace cozy with really satisfying and flavorful food, definitely check out La Isla.

I loved this place. Crazy authentic. At home I keep it high vegan so if I'm going to have meat it better be worth it. It was. I felt like I was in my mom's kitchen. Lots of cute decorations (Celia Cruz pics everywhere, what what).On to the eats...Empanadas were filled to exploding with deliciously sazonada carne molida. And it's big enough to share.Pernil sandwich was simple, letting the pernil do all the talking.Cubano was perfect with gooey cheese and just the right amount of all essential ingredients.Only had half of my sandwich so I could have room for flan and tres leche. (we were sharing!)Nice presentation and just the right amount of sweet with un cafe con leche (I'd given up coffee but when in Rome) to finish off the meal. We were there around 2:30 and we were the only patrons. Staff was friendly and attentive.Oh, and they were playing some serious Latin tunes from the old days that hubby and I were grooving to.Um, seriously grooving to as in one step away from getting up and busting a move. ( I SAID we were the only patrons).I will definitely go back the next time I'm hankering for days gone by.
The stuffed French toast is beyond amazing. I suggest everyone to try it at least one. They are famous for their French toast. The papa relleno is also delicious.

As hard as it can be to get up on a Sunday morning before 10a, it's worth it for this place.We finally made it here for the Sunday brunch last week, and we were not disappointed.  I've been there for lunch a few times and loved it every time.  But I wanted to get there for brunch for so long that I figured I would be disappointed when I finally made it... and I wasn't.The stuffed french toast is ridiculous.  It's a perfect piece of bread, and the filling is amazing.  The iced coffee is strong but good.  And the chorizo is perfect.  The service is nice, and they get you out of there pretty quickly.

Wow I was so impressed by the food at la isla!  I've been wanting to eat at la isla for years but have just never gotten around to it.  I dragged my bf there about a year ago but he refused to eat there because he claimed it smelled like "urinal cakes" when we walked in! To his credit it was a hot summer day and the smell was not appetizing.My bf finally caved in and agreed to give la isla a try when another couple raved about this place and suggested we meet there for dinner. You should not go to la isla for the ambiance or the decor, however if you're looking for really good Cuban food this is your place. Also, they don't take reservations.We started out with beef empanadas - yum!!! I got the shrimp and garlic with white rice and it was incredibly tasty. My bf and the other couple all got the chimichuri steak and it was very flavorful. We will def be coming back here, just sad we didn't try this place out sooner before when we lived around the block.

Food is delicious,but I feel out of place You walk in and no one says can i help you,they just look at you as if to say,"what are you doing here. I've ordered take out a few times and always get the same treatment ."Perhaps they don't like anyone who's not hispanic and my money is no good there. I asked other non- Hispanics. And they got the same treatment as I did ,

I went there for a Sunday Brunch with my friend, he had the huevos rancheros which my friend enjoyed very much  and I had the churrasco a caballo which was very delicious as well, my only complaint is that I felt rushed by our sever who took my plate without asking me  if I was finished, I kind of let it go cuz I wanted to save room for desert but he immediately brought our check, so my friend asked  him if they had tres leches dessert for us to know and make a decision if we wanted to stay and have dessert  but he didn't answer and seemed annoyed,  and  just brought it to us.....A waiter must always ask if you are done especially if there is still food on the plate, never assume and at least offer dessert, other that that food at La Isla is delicious We'd definitely come back.....

Brunch Review...At 11:30 Sunday morning, we stopped in to grab a bit to eat, mainly because there was a line and, I thought to myself..."Good sign!".  Lo and behold, I was right, as usual! Item #1 - Stuffed French Toast with fresh strawberry cream cheese and guava syrup.  I am not a french toast fan at all but this was DELICIOUS.  Crispy on the outside sweet and creamy on the inside.  So good.  Item #2 - Omelette with fresh spinach, queso blanco and sweet plantains.  Wow, another home run.  The sweet and salty combination was balanced...not overwhelming at all.  I didn't try to the potatoes on the side.  Item #3 - Side of a ham croquette.  I've never had anything like this before but it was okay.  I'm sure it was fantastic for those who love smokey ham flavor but that's not really my thing. Items #4 & 5  - Shakes...One guava (no milk), one banana (with milk).  Both were good but banana shakes remind me of baby food so I'm not a huge fan regardless of how good and the guava one was a tiny bit too sweet for my taste.  The wait time wasn't bad for two but the service was weird.  Our order came out at all different times...First french toast, then omelette a few minutes later.  Then a few more minutes later the banana shake.  Fast forward five minutes more later and the ham croquette followed two minutes later by the guava shake.  No rhyme or reason to how/when they bring out food and drink.  I quickly forgot about that, though, once I actually tasted the food.  For a bill of $32 with tip, it was a perfect brunch!

You got a craving for Ham, swiss, pickles?  How about chicken and rice.   It's here.  Hoboken's got a few Cuban spots, but this one reminds me of the places in Miami.  It's pretty damn good.I've recently had a craving for dill pickles on a sandwich, and I'm not sure why, but it is what it is.  I ordered the Croqueta Preparada and the Papa Rellena  I had delivery so I'm sure I didn't get the full experience.  The place doesn't look like much from the outside...maybe 4 open air tables.  The food took a while to get here, but it was a Saturday night so they get a pass.The papa rellena was a mashed potato dish (comes in a ball) with a hard outside, soft center.  Inside is ground beef.  it reminds me almost of an irish dish.  It was quite satisfying.  The potato was very tender inside with just enough crispiness on the outside.  the beef inside was delicious and ample.  I did not seem greasy or unhealthy, and  didn't feel full or weighted  down before I proceeded to the main course.The croqueta was  was great.  The cheese was hot and stringy (good sign that delivery order didn't sit long).  The ham was great and the pickles were crispy.  My only "complaint" if you can call it that is that the bread seemed a bit tougher than I wanted it to be.Overall, I was satisfied.  I almost got italian, but changed last minute because nothing was looking appetizing.  I had the chicken and rice here last time, and I loved it.  They definitely give you a generous  portion.  If you like Cuban, La Isla is where it's at in Hoboken.

I ordered the churrasco con chimichurri with fried yucca and moro. The steak was prepared well and it was my first time having yuca and I'm a fan. My lil sis had the oxtail stew with boiled yuca and yellow rice. Her meal was good also. The restaurant is really small and luckily we didnt have to wait for a table. The service was ok but I did enjoy the food here. Another thing I didnt like while eating here was when one of the staff members would sweep and mop while we ate. Anyways, we plan on coming back to try their breakfast. I'm dying to try their stuffed french toast.

Delicious!!!! Made me feel like I was back home in Miami. The croquetas alone are worth driving from Queens to Hoboken. The staff was friendly but the food was on point. Will be returning with more Cuban friends! Haha

What?!?! I never wrote a review about la isla??? How could I ??? I am ashamed. GOOD STUFF: the cuban sandwich. ask for some hot sauce. The best cuban sandwich in the area. No matter what I order, this is a must have for me. (in addition to my main meal) Their fried plantains. delicious. No one can really mess up on fried plantains. I know... but this is great! Their steak .Delicious. Perfectly seasoned. Great chimichurri sauce. Its tied for best skirt steak in the area for me... but the other place i like is a cheaper. but still great. great coffee! it's rich, dark, robust. and I love my coffee. Their breakfast is pretty solid too. thought i must say ... the french toast felt a little overrated. it's good but maybe because i'm not a huge sweets person. (definitely not a sweet breakfast person) Been here so many times! I don't know why I didn't review it yet. Can you tell... you should go. well... maybe. causeBAD STUFF: very small placealways packedhard parking but it's BYOB!!!! :):):):):) so... if you have patience all the bad stuff goes down the drain.

I don't eat at La Isla often and when I do, it's because I am really craving Hispanic food. Most of the food is tasty, have def had BETTER Cuban food though. I personally think the best things there are the tostones with mojo and the chicken noodle soup. Add some vinegar, hot sauce and white rice to the soup and it is superb! The soups is actually pretty cheap for the large size that comes with rice. Overall will come again for soup or just with friends. The place is too small to actually enjoy it though. Meh.

I took my wife and kids here on a Sunday for brunch. The place is tiny and had a small wait, but we didn't mind that.The food was awesome, though it came out a little slow. The waiter was not very happy initially when he seated us, but thankfully his mood got better as the day progressed. My guess is  had a Mojito to fix it;-)The quantity is good, and the drinks are amazing!We will return again to taste Omar's famous French Toast.

Good food, small place, gets crowded fast. I like to sample the Cuban sandwiches at every Cuban Restaurant I visit, this place had a decent Cuban. However my meal (Yea the Cuban was an appetizer) was delicious. Steak was good and my girl loved her meal as well.

Great cuban food in a small unpretentious cafe in Hoboken.I just love this place and its our go-to place when we just want nice warm comfort food.Start with the empanadas - either chicken or beef.  I went for the beef -- the filling is generous and flavorful -- in a crusty pastry shell that is not soggy.  I just love it!  We also had the croqueta de jamon, a nice ground smoked ham and onion flavor.For the main, I had the grilled skirt steak with chimichurri sauce.  The steak was seasoned and grilled perfectly and the winner was the chimichurri sauce.  Such a great balance of flavor.  If you are not afraid of carbs, I suggest the yellow rice or the black beans with rice -- both are great compliments.  Then of course, you will need to have plantains --- the best is the twice fried green plantains with garlic sauce.Then we had dessert -- and this is the reason why I come back to this place.  The key lime pie with cilantro sauce is just amazing.  Its sweet, tart then you get some saltiness from the almonds.  A great punctuation mark to your dinner.  The service is quick and the servers are very friendly.  And its BYOB, so you can buy a good bottle of wine a couple of doors away and enjoy it with great food!

Deliciousness in a roll. I've loved everything I've ever ordered from here.Sometimes it can be hard to order for pick-up, they close early sometimes. Definitely a top place for flavorful sandwiches. They also give me extra hot sauce too :)
Awesome brunch spot! On Sunday's only, they have the la papa! It is a small place inside, but that dos not matter because the food is so good here. The wait staff is helpful too.

Delicious!! Came for dinner wanting nom-fried and tasty and this spot superseded expectations. Guac for a starter was fresh and chunky. The Camarines Enchillado shrimp dinner was flavorful w a lil spicy but not hot. Amazing and on point!! A winner!!!

I had a terrible experience in  La isla restaurant.  I sign my name to ge a table and not only it was very hot and noisy but they kept giving my table to couples that didn't even sighn inn.  When I asked why I was waiting for so long and they were skipping names they totally ignore me.  The waiters were very disrespectful specially a heavy tall black hair mexican.  They run around like if  this is a park, very unprofecional.  I will never return to this restaurant nor will recommended to friends and family.
Stuffed french toast!  Thats all that needs to be mentioned.. Try it if you dont mind waiting a little while for a table.

My favorite restaurant in Hoboken.  Been there tons of times for brunch, lunch, and dinner.  Loved everything I got except for their stuffed french toast which was overwhelmingly sweet.About half the time I just get a cuban sandwich.  Delicious and under $10.Best appetizer is their Papa Relina, basically ground beef in a ball of fried mashed potatoes.If you are going for a meal, I loved all of their entrees, but especially the steak with caramelized onions.

Absolutely delicious Cuban food at a low price. I loved the Cuban sandwich and I can't wait to go back and try something else. Try the croquettas.Only downside: very crowded at times, spartan decor and service is just "decent".

I have yet to have a bad meal here. Eaten here prob 6 times, both breakfast and lunch and loved every minute of it. The french toast (stuffed, food network famous) is amazing, calories filled and totally worth it! Share with a friend and feel less guilty.  Good omelettes, maduros, arroz con habicheulas, tasty lechon (roasted and shredded pork), yummy empanadas...I love everything I've eaten here.The last time my man and I ate here we realized this place is the most consistently delicious place we go to. Yummy batidos, cafe con leche, todo esta ricissimo!!cons: tiny space, some seats are better than others. Can be hard to flag down a server excepto si hable espanol ;)

La Isla is my go to spot in Hoboken. Food is excellent quality for the price, service is prompt and attentive, BYOB, and the brunch is off the hook.  If I could only eat in one place in Hoboken, this would be it!

pretty busy on weekends. wait staff is okay, but one of the ladies can be rude.  ordered the pan con bistect (steak sandwich). not bad, but bland. they should either add a sauce, cheese, or use a flavored bread. I had to douse the sandwich in a lot of tabasco sauce. also ordered fried yucca on the side, which was good. tried some of the ensalada de berro, which was good, but kind of pricy for just a bed of greens. heard their brunch was great but only served till noon on saturdays so missed out.

I am La Isla 5 stars because of its amazzzzzing french toast... that's all.. I didn't let anythiiiing else phase me (random delivery boy with sacks of black beans coming past me, chipped tea mug, not strong air condition on 85 degree weather...)... I am giving 5 stars because I walked in ordered stuffed french toast (living near Hoboken and watching Bobby Flay challenge him and lose, I knew it was necessary).. plus guava syrup.. don't get that everywhereI would skip on the omelette's.. not intriguing, rather mediocre... but again, that will not hurt my review for the restaurant.. Warning: not MUCH seating space, long waits on the weekends...) I had two poached eggs in a corn tortilla bowl with black beans, a spicy tomato sauce and white rice that would also be a testament to the 5-star rating...

Whether you come in for the Cuban latte, stuffed french toast, or their signature huevos rancheros, La Isla will not disappoint! This quaint spot is always filled to the brim on the weekends, and is great for lunch during the week as well. Be sure to get there early to get on the list for a table, though you can always sit at their diner style bar area as you wait. I guarantee once you come once, La Isla's menu and service will have you coming back for seconds and thirds.
The Brunch here is amazing. Huevos Rancheros are phenomenal. The wait can get pretty long at times so be prepared to wait for a table or spot at the bar- but it's worth it!

Hole in the wall. Uncomfortable to dine there. The food quality is good but the prices are unreasonable. I would recommend Rumba Cubana in Guthenburg(Vlv East and 69th St) for a  true Cuban experience. Food quality is very good. The place is beautiful and spacious. Drinks are amazing (try the guava sangria).. the prices are very, very fair. You won't be sorry.

Just read the reviews, no need to expand.  Amazing authentic cuban food.  At least that's what they tell me.  I can tell you it is so delicious.  Not a romantic, great atmosphere type of place, but so good.  BYO.

I've only been here for breakfast/brunch so my review is based on that. Their sweet breakfast options are delicious! French toast, pancakes and dessert fruit and coffe drinks are a can't miss. Definitely recommend the Omar's French toast! For eggs the omelettes are just ok, so I'd recommend the egg sandwich or a different egg platter.  Unless you go early be prepared to wait for a table.
